noun.description: A journey or voyage undertaken by a group of people with a particular purpose, especially that of exploration, scientific research, or war.
examples: an expedition to the jungles of the Orinoco

noun.description: Promptness or speed in doing something.
examples: the landlord shall remedy the defects with all possible expedition

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin expeditio(n-), from expedire extricate (see expedite). Early senses included prompt supply of something and setting out with aggressive intent. The notions of speed and purpose are retained in current senses. expedition (sense 1) dates from the late 16th century.
